body:
Dropping the pins on the map works perfectly! To go one step further and make your app stand out you can also support "Hold and Drag":

Utilize the other [UIGestureRecognizer](https://developer.apple.com/library/prerelease/ios/documentation/UIKit/Reference/UIGestureRecognizer_Class/index.html#//apple_ref/c/econst/UIGestureRecognizerStateBegan) states here.
To support "Hold and drag" you could do the following for each state:
* On state ``` .began ``` , the pin will be created.
* On  ``` .changed ``` , At this point, you update the first pin coordinates to change the position of the pin
* On  ``` .ended ```  , In this state the user has lifted a finger and you are free to persist the pin.
A more fitting name for this view controller might be **MapViewController**. Giving meaningful names to our view controllers, variables, etc. helps us navigate the code easier.
